Key Match Events: Cleveland Cavaliers dominated the visiting Golden State Warriors in the first half, leading 83-42 after the first 24 minutes.
Darius Garland led the Cavaliers with 27 points, six assists, three rebounds, and three steals.
Jonathan Kuminga came off the bench to lead the Warriors with 21 points, six rebounds, five assists, and one block.
The Warriors' Steph Curry, who didn't see action in the fourth quarter, had 12 points on 5-for-10 shooting, including 1-for-4 from behind the arc.
Cleveland shot 14-for-22 from deep compared to Golden State's 5-for-16 clip in the first half, allowing them to grab a stranglehold on the game.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavaliers improved their record to 10-0, while the Warriors dropped to 7-2.
Ty Jerome, a former Warrior, led Cleveland's onslaught with 13 second-quarter points.
Steve Kerr did not insert Curry in the fourth quarter.
The Warriors couldnâ€™t put together a desperate rally as the Cavaliers had an answer to everything they threw at them.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers had a 19-2 run in the first five minutes.
The Warriors gave up 78 points before the two-minute mark of the second period.
